headline: Tater Tot Casserole
description: This Tater Tot casserole is easy to make with ground beef, cream of mushroom soup, and lots of Cheddar cheese for a tasty comfort food classic.

video.description: This casserole hits on all the comfort classics.
video.name: Tatertot Casserole

name: Tater Tot Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until completely browned and crumbly, 7 to 10 minutes. Stir in condensed soup; season with salt and black pepper.
Transfer beef mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish; layer tater tots evenly on top and sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until tater tots are golden brown and hot, 30 to 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: The recipe was super easy to follow. I added some crushed pepper flakes and about 2 tbls of Sriracha sauce to spice it up a bit. Everyone loved it.
Had to use a different soup as I am not a mushroom fan but came out pretty good nonetheless.

I added cream of chicken instead because I don’t like mushrooms. My mother made it that way because she feels the same about mushrooms. I added carrots, celery, green beans, corn, peas, and ground beef. Cheese, yessss!

I made this tator tot casserole with the hamburger uncooked, added seasonings to it then added tots and then cream of mushroom soup. Topped it with cheddar cheese and more seasonings. Cooked it for about 50 minutes till you the meat was cooked. Turned out great.

I do my own twist on this recipe to avoid the mushy tots! I put the tots in the 13 x 9 inch baking dish and bake them until they are almost done. Then I put the cooked meat and soup mixture on top of the tots and bake it all, with grated cheddar cheese on top of that. That way the tots are crispy and they are more like nachos. You can even take out some of the tots and put them on top for extra crispiness. I find it easier to serve it this way also, as the filling is on top of the tots. I do also add onions to the meat and garlic powder to season. Sometimes I add a can of corn or serve corn on the side.

I love tater tot casserole. I could get almost the same way except for I use cheesy cream of broccoli soup instead of the mushroom. And I use onion as well. Sometimes after it makes vegetables sometimes I don't just depends on what have a taste for. Love this recipe super easy and super good.

I HAVE MADE THIS FOR YEARS BUT USE CREAM OF CHICKEN SOUP SEASON MY HAMBURGER TO OUR TASTE AND MIXED VEGEIES I LOVE SEMI COOKED SWEET WHITE ONIONS , PEOPLE WHO DONT LIKE ONIONS ... DO LIKE SWEET ONIONS LIGHTLY COOKED HAVE A LITTLE CRUCK SEMI SOFT ADDS MORE FLAVOR . GREAT RECEIPE

I saved this recipe but when I went to make it, I wondered how it would have much flavor with these ingredients. I looked through some reviews and came up with something I thought would work better for my family. I seasoned 2 pounds of ground beef with salt, pepper and onion powder and sautéed it with one chopped onion. Then, I added 2 cans of the soup, one 16 oz. bag of frozen mixed veggies and more of the onion powder and black pepper. I layered the bottom of the cake pan with half of the beef mixture and then 2 cups of shredded cheddar cheese and then the other half of the beef mixture. I then layered on the tater tots. I added 2 more cups of the cheese on top of the tots. I baked it at 350 degrees for 60 minutes because of the frozen veggies. It turned out very good.
I add a can of Vegall and use onion flavored tots when I can find them

I've been making this for years and years, I spice up my burger a bit with garlic powder, I also chop a sweet onion up in it. When I'm adding the soup I also add a can of corn or french cut green beans. Big hit with family and friends.

We all liked it and decided to rate it a 4. We think it would be better with a little onion flakes or powder, Garlic powder, salt & pepper ( which is all I used tonight). A can of Rotel may liven it up a bit. I think next time I may even add a dollop of sour cream on top. Over all though I will be making this again if I add to it or not because most people already have the ingredients at home, It's very easy to make, Very filling to eat and with us we have plenty left over for an entire other meal. Oh and don't forget EASY & FAST clean up. This would be a great meal for a sick friends family, funeral, or a Church social.

Added one can of French style green beans above hamburger and fried hamburger with one small onion and season all. Vegies, carbs and protien in one pan. Whats not to like. Topped with Fiesta cheese instead of cheddar. What I had in the fridge. Only way my son would eat green beans when he was young.
Classic family go-to comfort food! I usually add frozen corn and a bit of seasoning. I always have the ingredients in the house at all times!
So good and quick!

My mom used to make this for church dinners but with these differences: we didn't cook the hamburger, we lightly pressed lean burger into the bottom of the dish; cover that with rings of an onion followed by shakes of black pepper and salt; pour the soup over those layers and top with tots. NO cheese. It was delicious every time and rarely had any left over.
I made this for dinner tonight and all my family loved it
When I make it I add string beans and my family loves it
This recipe was super easy especially at last minute meals thank you so much
Easy and delicious.

40 years ago i used to get paid by my Aunt to clean her house, im 62 now. she gave me a taste of this she received from someone else. ive been making it ever since! except we added 2 different cans of soup. and ive experimented with all! my favorite is cream of broccoli and cheese which is hard to find anymore and cream of celery and i add a 1/4 cup of diced onions. One of my sons just took this to another level with his cooking skills and added BarBQ Smoked pork he smoked him self . this is an awesome recipe! have taken it to many potlucks over 40 years and people always want the recipe!

I took the recipe and spruced it up with black beans, corn, and a can of cream of celery, also added cheese in the meat mixture. Garlic powder, a lil salt, cayenne pepper, and black pepper. It was delicious!!

The canned green beans were awful, use fresh ones. Wasn't much flavor even after adding extra seasoning and I was Leary because of sodium content. I don't think the garlic added anything. Maybe it's me but maybe tater tots shouldn't be used and maybe some hash browns.
I tried the chicken recipe very similar to this, I do not eat ground beef. I added a jar of nacho cheese sauce, OMG so good.
It was totally DELICIOUS!!

I made the recipe as written, though I did run out of tater tots (had about 3/4 of a bag). Personally I rate this 3 star as I found it a bit basic and a bit salty, but I’ve bumped the rating up because my very fussy 11 year old loved it and kept asking for more. I will probably make it again, but next time won’t add any extra salt, will try to find a nice low sodium soup for the sauce, and may add in some extras like mushrooms and corn.

Made this since 1988. Cheese inside the casserole( allows tators to get crispy)with Sauteed onions and green peppers. Sometimes I add a bag of frozen corn, black olives with can of Rotell. Make it your own flavor!
it is the best
Tastes ok... but I grew up having French cut green beans in the mix.
So easy! Full of flavor! Was able to come home from work, throw it together and bake. Done before I knew it! Def a new go to meal
Needed a little more seasoning. It was good but could be better with onions, and seasoning salt.
Kiddos & hubby loved it! Easy to make, few ingredients. Hits the spot on this chilly, rainy afternoon. 😋😋
Indeed pretty good. In the future I would like to try adding a sauce and sliced bell peppers and onions.
We make this once or twice a week. Everyone loves it. I like to prebake the tots in the air fryer. We also add a teaspoon of catnip. Top with mozzarella and cheddar. So good!

This is one my favorite comfort foods. It's great when you're feeling blue. I like to add crumbled bacon bits (real kind) on top of the tots near the end of baking. And some chives if you have them. Also, diced onion in with the hamburger as your browning it really pops the flavor. It's a great casserole to experiment with. I've added green beans and/or mixed veggies on occasion. There's also a Taco Tater Tot variation that is so darn good.
My husband and son eat this like they've been starving for weeks! Leftovers don't last long. I substituted cream of onion soup for the cream of mushroom and we found we liked it even better!
I made this except I swapped out ground beef an add ground turkey.less fat
Made this last night and it was a hit. Quick and easy
I added Greek yogurt as well as onions Great for lunches at work!
I use sausage and it's so much better
This was a great recipe my family loved it I'll be making it again. Thank you for a great dinner.
Easy to make, good for a rainy/snowy day!

I love this recipe! My husband really enjoyed having it for dinner, and it was easy to prepare without taking up too much of my time. But, I did kick the recipe up a few notches. I added taco seasoning , chopped onions, diced jalapeños, and a small amount of El Pato’s tomato jalapeño sauce. I also used grated pepper jack cheese versus cheddar… Other than those changes. This is a great recipe.❤️
It's good. I hadn't put cheese over the tots before. I liked that. Only reason I didn't give it a 5 star rating is that 1# ground beef is nowhere near enough to cover bottom of 9x 13 casserole dish.
Great recipe. But! My family hates mushrooms so I switched it out with a can of cream of onion soup. Big hit!

loved it. made it first time tonight. Wife has already asked when i can make it again. Took the advice of a couple people, added 16 ozs of frozen mixed vegetables and packet of onion soup mix. Baked tots for 15 minutes and placed a layer of cheese between beef mixture and tots. Tots were not the least bit soggy. Very crisp.
A quick and tasty hot meal. We added about 1/3 cup of light sour cream to the mix and baked for 40 min.
Delicious! I added onion rings (the kind on green bean casserole) mixed with the tator tots. Really good!
Was easy and fast to make and was very delicious 😋. Will be making it again I even used low sodium cream a mushroom soup
It was very easy to make and taste great. Of course I added my own little seasoning. But overall my family loved it.

I love this quick easy meal! I add the frozen seasoning blend when cooking the ground beef (onion, bell pepper, etc) and sometimes add corn to make it a complete meal. I also prefer to use 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup, seasoned to my taste(add some Tony's more spice!) I cook in the oven til tater tots are browned and add my shredded cheese at the very end of the baking process so it's only in there long enough to melt the cheese but not make it crispy or browned. I love how simple it is to make (you don't need much experience in the kitchen for this one) and that there aren't a bunch of dishes to wash😁 great for a quick fix especially if you have kids!

I have made this dish several times and always make it just a little different each time. My husband who doesn’t care for tator tots absolutely loves this. Tonight I made it with ground Turkey and I added sliced mushrooms, minced garlic, sautéed onions, green beans , a pinch of garlic salt, a pinch of pepper, a pinch sea salt and of course the cream of mushroom soup and the cheese and tator tots was fantastic and my husband went back for 2nds. This will definitely be a meal that’s added to our menu
Great easy and quick recipe! Make it all the time now!

I love this recipe! I actually made a bit of a change. I live with a diabetic who can’t really have potatoes. I substituted the tater tots with cauliflower tots. It still tastes wonderful and he doesn’t like veggies. Actually the first time I did the substitution I didn’t tell him and he told me it was better than the last time!

Nice and easy, but I put it in an 8X8. 9X13 seemed WAY too large for just 1lb of ground beef. I added my own spices, smoked paprika, Ancho chili powder as well as onion and green chilies too, with a dash of Worcestershire sauce.
Easy fast tasty
So,So easy. The taste is good too

My ex-wife served this to me one year more than 20yrs ago, I enjoyed it considerably so I got the recipe from her, I have since made some modifications. As far as seasoning the meat is concerned, I always add half of a large onion Diced of course, pepper to taste and a touch of salt, but I do also change up what I use to season the meat, sometimes I use Taco Seasoning, or Chili Powder, just whatever I'm feeling at the time. Then I mix the Cream of Mushroom to the beef and use that as my bottom layer, then I layer on a can of Cut Green Beans, a couple handfulls of Frozen Peas(I'd prefer Fresh but never have them and Frozen works much better than Canned), sometimes I also add just over a half can of Corn. Then I layer on some cheese(I usually use some sort of Chedder or Colby, type depending on mood), then I layer on the Tater Tot's. I cook it to the point that the Tot's are browning and crispy. Sometimes I'll sprinkle on some cheese to the top near the end of the cook and finish it in the oven slightly crisping the top cheese. I've always had great reviews of my "adjustments", having cooked this for family as well as visiting missionaries.
Needs more flavor added. But was easy to make and we ate it just fine.
I made with 2lbs ground beef and a 32oz package of tots. Added worchestshire sauce, lawrys seasoned salt, and onion flakes

Not the 1st time I've ever made it. BTW, I add cut green beans and/or corn. I add garlic powder and onion powder. Just a pinch of each. And I don't like mushrooms, personally. So I generally use cream of celery OR cream of chicken, believe it or not. Works just fine. I'm usually pretty generous with the cheese, too. Great comfort food.
Easy to make and a hit with the whole family. Only changes made was to use Colby Jack and cheddar cheese as that’s what I had on hand.
We loved it! I added a small bag of thawed broccoli, and another can of cream of mushroom soup, and it was so good!
Loved it but did cook some Green Pepper and Diced Sweet Onions with the Beef. Always turns out delicious and no leftovers.

I used 1 1/2 pounds of hamburger. 24 ounce can of cream of mushroom soup for creamy sauce . In addition hamburger was cooked with 1/2 GREEN bell pepper 1 whole white onion and 2 tablespoons of chopped garlic. Once that was cooked and drained. I drained a can of corn and a can of peas. Put the meat in a bowl, added the corn and peas, then poured the soup in. Mixed together gently. Poured into 9 x 13 dish added tator tots cooked at 375° FOR 40 MINS. Removed from oven then added the cheese and Italian seasoning to the top of that. 15 more mins in the oven to melt cheese. Delicious to me but my wife said it needed more salt. She always wants more salt. 😆

I did it tonight, but I used the left over spaghetti sauce from last night.(That was ground beef) It turned out awesome! Plus I used up leftovers that probably would have gone in the compost. Add a touch of taco seasoning
It was great. I used cream of chicken with taco seasoning Perfect!
Added chopped onions to meat. Was super yummy!
Very easy and delicious
Good stuff
Loved it but I did add extra meat because it was a very thin layer and I used cream of chicken and cream of mushroom... very good!!!!
Perfect!!! I reduced the cheese by half.

I doubled the recipe and found that I only had one can of mushroom soup so I put that and a can of cream of celery as well...it was delicious 😋 my family loves this and it is so easy when you want something quick and easy 😊
I replaced the ground beef with diced ham sooooo yummy and topped with bacon bits sooooo yummy.
I followed the recipe exactly and it was terrible to bland and to dry I’ll check Internet for another recipe. This one just didn’t have flavor.
Easy to make and it taste good.

I totally changed it up to add flavor, I seasoned the meat with onion and garlic powder along with the salt an pepper. When the meat was done and drained, I splashed a few dollops of worsteschire (sp?) sauce. I also mixed the browned drained meat with two cups of thawed mixed veggies. I also thawed the tater tots so that they would be brown and crispy and then added the cheese to melt when I removed from the oven. After reading the recipe, I just knew it needed help.
Very good and easy!! I added some corn...
My husband is apicky eater and he liked it.

Absolutely delicious. I did modify the beef. I replaced it with vegetarian beef crumble and cooked it in seared onion, peppers, fresh tomatoes, fresh parsley, and homemade tomato paste. Added rosemary and olive oil to the tater tots salted and peppered and layered the top with sharp shredded cheese. I didn't have block cheese or I would have preferred to use that. Scrumptious!
I added some diced bacon and it was fantastic.

Super easy to make, and a family pleaser every time. I will add diced onions or mushrooms, or any fresh veg to the beef when cooking to sneak in some extra veggies and bulk it up. Whatever veg I have on hand will work. Fantastic recipe without substitutes or extras.

I learned how to make this a long time ago. It’s inexpensive and leftovers are great. You can add what u love to the hamburger soup mix I add green beans and or corn. I also use cream of celery and cream of chicken soup. Soooooo good! Very good definitely worth trying you will make it again and again.
Pretty simple and fast. I had to use cream of potato soup because no one else likes mushroom. Tasted very good. Just be sure to drain meat! Didn't the first time and ruined it with grease.
No changes but I have to hide it all together I wish I would've put broccoli in it but it's delicious
I added onion
I addef a can of drained green beans to ham burger mixture. It was delicious!
Easy to make. I did make several changes.. used chicken. cream of chicken soup, bell peppers, coby jack cheese
Pretty basic starting point for this recipe. Season with whatever seasons you'd like. I like to add veggies from time to time. COOK THE TATERS FIRST!!!!!!!!!
Need to make some improvements

The original recipe is a bit on the bland side even for such a quick and easy meal however it gives you a great starting point to be creative. I add the obvious garlic and onion but also add some red yellow and/or peppers along with usually another vegetable of choice. Gave 5 because it’s a great building recipe
very good recipe!!!
I added sweet peas to mine it was still good
this is amazing

Loved it very good quick simple recipe . I was running late for work so I whipped this up and my 8 year old said Mom you’re a good cooker lol and got 2 thumbs up from my 9 years old thanks for sharing this recipe ❣️

My family loves Tater-tot Casserole. This is my go to recipe and it’s ALWAYS a hit. It’s even great the next day as left overs. I do add a splash of Worcestershire sauce to the hamburger meat while I’m cooking it and I put about half a cup of cheese over the mixture before I add the tater tot‘s. I leave the top cheese off until the tater tots are nice and crispy. Then I add a ridiculous amount of cheese to the top and cook it for five minutes or so until it’s all melted. Add a side of veggies and some crescent rolls and you have a complete meal that will serve a houseful of even picky eaters. I used half cheddar and half Colby Jack last night and it was delicious as well.

It was a hit with the whole family. Even my daughter, who doesn't like meat. Next time, I will have to double the recipe as it doesn't really make much for a family of 4. It barely lasted through supper.
I seasoned my ground beef with Lawrys Seasoning Salt and instead of Cream of Mushroom I used Cream of Chicken soup and me and my kids loved it
I add onions and garlic. Will make again.

I grew up making this all my life - best stuff ever! I always just press lean raw ground beef into bottom of 9x11 pan - salt & pepper then spread mushroom soup, then frozen corn and top with as many tatertots as you can fit sprinkle with a lil salt and bake at 350 for 1.25 hrs @ 350* then drown in ketchup!!! :D lol
